title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), with the
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the District Court (Fees) (Amendment)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the District Court (Fees) (Amendment) 

Order 2022. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 26 January 2022.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited district court (fees) (amendment) order 2022 (2) order come operation 26 january 2022

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), with the
heading: 2. The District Court (Fees) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 22 of 2014) (as amended
text_raw:
2. The District Court (Fees) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 22 of 2014) (as amended 
by Article 2 of the District Court (Fees) (Amendment) (No. 2) Order 2021 (S.I. 
No. 534 of 2021)) is amended by the substitution of the following Article for 
Article 4C: 

“4C. Notwithstanding Article 2, no fee shall be payable under this 
Order in respect of the item specified in column (1) of Part 4 of the 
Schedule, at reference number 7, where the application is for a special 
exemption order that, if granted, would – 

(a) have effect on or after 26 January 2022, and 

(b) 

expire, in accordance with section 5(5) of the Intoxicating 
Liquor Act 1927 (No. 15 of 1927), on or before 1 May

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)), with the
text_raw:
2022.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 28th January, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Order. 

[34] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure and Reform, 

25 January, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

25 January, 2022. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice.
